preqs: Students must have passed six graduate units or 36 credit points including one of the following units: MKX5461, MKX9160, MKX9550, MBA9006 or MBA5906 or be enrolled in course 3783 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 36 (I/W) credit points at levels {5, 9} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MBA5906, MBA9006, MKF5461, MKF5916, MKX5461, MKX5955, MKX9160, MKX9550} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3783} Do (Must have passed 30 (I/W) credit points at levels {5, 9} OR  (Must have passed 36 (I/W) credit points AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MBA9006, MKX5461, MKX5955, MKX9160, MKX9550})) Otherwise true

description: This unit prepares students to work in a new marketing environment where new products and services that tackle environmental degradation and social inequity are endowing firms with enduring competitive advantage. It examines the core principles of sustainability from both micro-marketing (consumer, firm) and macro-marketing (society, economy) perspectives and equips students with thinking tools to develop sustainable marketing strategies for private and public firms.
